p: Host variables that underlie the emergence of infectious diseases include those variables specific to individuals within the host population and those variables that relate to the host population as a whole ( Morens and Fauci, 2012; Morens etÂ al., 2004, 2008a). Since a virus replicates within the cells of the host, and since viruses usually infect hosts via specific receptors on the cells of various tissues and organs, the new host must express cellular receptors or other cell-surface properties to which the virus can bind and initiate viral internalization.
